answers.answer: My daughter developed eclampsia, if you already had the baby, its not pre-eclampsia, it's postpartum eclampsia.  She had her seizure 3 days after she had her baby.  It's been 3 months now and she is still having problems, the doctors put her on depakote and high blood pressure meds, but she is still having problems with being dizzy and vision problems, no one seems to be able to help her, the fact is there is not enough cases of postpartum eclampsia, because having the baby is suppose to solve all those problems, she is now going to try a different doctor to see if that one can help, most doctors have had no experience with eclampsia.

question: I've been looking on the net and I can't find anything about anyone who developed pre-eclampsia after giving birth like me. I also developed Hellp Syndrome (liver failure and blood clotting problems) and acute renal failure as a result. I has gestational diabetes during the pregnancy aswell. I had pre-eclampsia with my first pregnancy and had to be induced at 36 weeks. Has anyone had this happen to them or even some of it? I know I can't be the only one, I want to know if anyone who had the same thing decided to have another baby. The outcome could be bad, but I've always wanted more.........
title: Did anyone have the same thing???
